Dispute_Type: Patent infringement dispute between brand-name and generic pharmaceutical manufacturers
Legal_Issue: Whether Nu-Pharm's process is an obvious chemical equivalent of Abbott's patented process
Evidence_Assessment: Expert affidavits and solubility data from the Merck Index were considered; court found solubility data supported Abbott's position
Decision_Outcome: Nu-Pharm's process found to be an obvious chemical equivalent; application for Notice of Compliance denied
Burden_of_Proof: On Abbott to demonstrate infringement of a valid patent
Credibility_Factor: Experts disagreed on equivalence, but court credited Abbott's expert evidence and scientific data
Legal_Rule: A generic manufacturer cannot market a drug if it infringes a valid patent; Claim 6 covers obvious chemical equivalents
Standard_of_Review: Objective assessment of whether the alternative process is an obvious chemical equivalent
Procedural_Issue: Use of summary proceedings under the NOC Regulations
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged infringement of Claim 6 of Abbott’s patent by use of water and room temperature in manufacturing process
Outcome_on_Merits: Abbott succeeded on the merits; infringement established
Decision_Maker: Court hearing the application under the NOC Regulations
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Not applicable – this was the initial decision, not a review
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Parties had opportunity to submit evidence; process conducted via summary proceedings with affidavit evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Expert affidavits, solubility data from the Merck Index
Legal_Framework: Regulatory framework governing generic drug approval and patent protection in Canada
Applicant_Challenge: Abbott challenged Nu-Pharm's eligibility for a Notice of Compliance
Legal_Rule_Source: Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations, Claim 6 of Abbott Patent
Defendant_Response: Nu-Pharm argued their process using water and room temperature was not an obvious chemical equivalent
Remedy_Requested: Prevention of Nu-Pharm obtaining a Notice of Compliance
Outcome: Nu-Pharm prohibited from receiving Notice of Compliance until patent expiration
Remedy_Sought: Interlocutory injunction or equivalent relief to block regulatory approval
Resolution_Mechanism: Summary judicial proceeding under regulatory regime
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Infringement of valid patent through use of obvious chemical equivalent
Applicable_Process: Notice of Compliance (NOC) proceedings under PM(NOC) Regulations
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application to prevent grant of NOC to Nu-Pharm
